bug.short_desc: Label font color not set when using setFont

long_desc.thetext:
When font is set to a label using setFont() method, the font color is not applied to the label text.
Playground example: http://bit.ly/V12fNc
This is due to the textColor property of the widget. It seems like the this property does have a higher priority. We should check the priorities and try to honor user values over themed values.

IMHO, the value applied should be of the property that isn't default.
Generally I'd want to create a font once and then apply it to multiple labels.
I can see 5 use cases here:
1. Font color is default. Label textColor is default - apply nothing.
2. Font color is default. Label textColor is set - apply label textColor.
3. Font color is set. Label textColor is default - apply font color.
4. Font color is set. Label textColor is set to the same value - apply either one.
5. Font color is set. Label textColor is set to a different value - decide which one has higher priority.
